allCourses.title: Tafsir Al-Qur'an: Surah Al-Baqarah
allCourses.shortDescription: A comprehensive, verse-by-verse study of Surah Al-Baqarah, exploring classical Tafsir, spiritual lessons, and practical applications.
allCourses.fullDescription:
In this detailed intermediate-level Tafsir course, students will journey through Surah Al-Baqarah — the longest Surah in the Qur’an. This course includes:

  • Context (Asbāb an-Nuzūl) and background of each passage
  • Explanation based on classical Tafsir sources
  • Deep linguistic reflections and thematic insights
  • Practical lessons relevant to modern life

By the end of the course, you will gain a clearer understanding of Allah’s guidance and a deeper spiritual connection with the Qur’an.

instructor.name: Sheikh Ahmad Al-Mansour
instructor.bio: Renowned Qur’an teacher and scholar with over 20 years of experience in Tafsir and Islamic education.

allCourses.title: Arabic Grammar Fundamentals (Nahw)
allCourses.shortDescription: Master the essential rules of Arabic syntax (النحو) — from sentence structure to case endings — designed for beginners and early intermediate students.
allCourses.fullDescription:
This practical beginner-to-intermediate course on Nahw (Arabic grammar) teaches you how Arabic sentences are built and how words relate to each other. The course covers:

  • Basic sentence types (nominal & verbal)
  • Case endings and how to recognise them in reading
  • Verb conjugation basics and verb-subject agreement
  • Important particles, idafa (possessive constructions), and common syntactic patterns

By the end of the course you'll be able to parse simple and medium-complexity Arabic sentences from classical and Qur'anic texts and write grammatically correct sentences with confidence.

instructor.name: Dr. Fatima Hassan
instructor.bio: Assistant professor of Arabic grammar with extensive teaching experience in Nahw and Qur’anic syntax.

lessons.title: Course Introduction & How to Use This Course

Demonstrative & Relative Pronouns (اسم الإشارة والاسم الموصول)
Verb Moods (الحالات الإنشائية) — Indicative, Subjunctive, Jussive
Particles of Emphasis & Restriction (إنما، فقط، حتى)
Dual & Plural Forms and Agreement Rules
Common Syntactic Errors & How to Avoid Them
Reading Qur'anic Examples: Applying Nahw to the Text
Transformations: From Simple to Complex Sentences

allCourses.title: Sahih Al-Bukhari: Selected Hadith
allCourses.shortDescription: A focused study of selected authentic hadith from Sahih al-Bukhari, covering meaning, chains of transmission, and practical application.
allCourses.fullDescription:
This intermediate-level course explores carefully chosen hadith from Sahih al-Bukhari. Each lesson examines the text, chain (isnād), classification, scholarly commentary, and contemporary application. The course equips students to understand hadith methodology and apply prophetic guidance in daily life.

  • Close reading of selected hadith with Arabic text and reliable translations
  • Explanation of the isnād and reasons for narrators' acceptance
  • Comparative commentary from classical and contemporary scholars
  • Practical lessons for worship, ethics, and community life

By the end of the course you will be able to analyse selected hadith, explain their legal and moral implications, and reference classical commentary responsibly.

instructor.name: Sheikh Abdullah Rahman
instructor.bio: Hadith scholar and teacher specialising in hadith methodology and practical application, with extensive experience teaching classical sources.

allCourses.title: Web Development with React & Next.js
allCourses.shortDescription: Learn to build modern web applications using React and Next.js, with hands-on projects and industry best practices.
allCourses.fullDescription:
This intermediate-level web development course guides students through building modern, performant web applications using React and Next.js. The course covers:

  • React fundamentals and advanced concepts
  • Next.js for server-side rendering and static sites
  • State management, routing, and API integration
  • Project-based learning to build real-world applications

By the end of this course, students will be able to develop scalable web applications and understand the best practices of modern frontend development.

instructor.name: Yusuf Ibrahim
instructor.bio: Experienced web developer and instructor specializing in React, Next.js, and modern frontend technologies.

allCourses.title: Graphic Design Fundamentals
allCourses.shortDescription: Learn the essentials of graphic design, including visual principles, tools, and real-world projects to build a strong portfolio.
allCourses.fullDescription:
This beginner-friendly course covers the foundations of graphic design. Students will learn:

  • Design principles: color theory, typography, composition
  • Software skills: Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and Figma
  • Branding, logo design, and visual identity
  • Practical projects to create a professional portfolio

By the end of this course, students will be able to design visually appealing graphics and understand the core principles of effective design.

allCourses.title: Digital Marketing Essentials
allCourses.shortDescription: A comprehensive beginner course on digital marketing covering SEO, social media, email campaigns, and analytics with real-world projects.
allCourses.fullDescription:
This beginner-friendly digital marketing course covers essential topics to launch and grow online campaigns. Students will learn:

  • Search Engine Optimization (SEO) and keyword research
  • Social media marketing strategies for major platforms
  • Email marketing, content creation, and branding
  • Analytics, conversion tracking, and campaign optimization
  • Practical projects and real-world case studies

By the end of the course, students will be able to plan, execute, and measure successful digital marketing campaigns.
